title: Split string into array of words
contentHtml:
Write a program to split string into array of words

Input  : "hello world"
Output : ["hello", "world"]

#include <iostream>
#include <vector>
#include <string>
using namespace std;

int main()
{
    string s,res="";
    getline(cin,s);
    vector<string> ans;
    for(int i=0;i<s.size();i++){
        if(s[i]==' '){
            ans.push_back(res);
            res="";
        }
        else res+=s[i];
    }
    ans.push_back(res);
    for(auto &it: ans) cout<<it<<'\n';
    return 0;
}

import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.Scanner;

public class SplitStringIntoArrayOfWords {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
        System.out.print("Enter the String: ");
        String str = sc.nextLine();
        System.out.println(Arrays.toString(splitString(str)));
    }
    static String [] splitString(String str){
        String [] result = str.split(" ");
        return result;
    }
}

function stringToArray(str){
 return str.split(' ');
}

console.log(stringToArray('hello world'));

def stringToArray(string) 
  string.split(' ')
end 
 
print stringToArray("hello world")

const SplitStringIntoArrayOfWords = (s: String): String[] => {
    let arrayOfWords: String[] = s.split(" ")
    return arrayOfWords;
}
export default SplitStringIntoArrayOfWords;

print(input().split(' '))

import 'dart:io';

void main() {
  print('Enter a string:');
  String? input = stdin.readLineSync();
  List<String>? words = input?.split(' ');
  print(words);
}

<?php

function string2Array($str) {
 print_r(explode(" ", $str));
}

string2Array('hello world');

?>

my $str ='hello world';
my @arr=split (/ /, $str);
print "@arr";

fn split_string(s: &str) -> Vec<&str> {
  s.split_whitespace().collect()
}

fn main() {
  let s = "hello world";
  let words = split_string(s);
  println!("{:?}", words);
}
